did.unittitle: James A. Ingalls Papers

repository.corpname: Archives & Special Collections at the Thomas J. Dodd Research Center, University of Connecticut Libraries

did.abstract: Contracts, correspondence, legal records, financial records, newspaper clippings and notes gathered and generated by James A. Ingalls, a field representative for the International Union of Electrical, Radio & Machine Workers, AFL-CIO, from the 1950s to the 1992. Materials give details from when Ingalls represented Connecticut local chapters to negotiate contracts, resolve strikes and lockouts, and develop collective bargaining agreements, pension plans and compensation and health benefits packages.

bioghist.head: Biography of James A. Ingall
bioghist.p: James A. Ingalls, born on September 23, 1922, of East Granby, Connecticut, was a Field Representative of the International Union of Electrical, Radio & Machine Workers, AFL-CIO, from the 1950s to 1992.
James A. Ingalls died on November 22, 1998, in Flagler, Florida.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The papers consist of materials generated and gathered by James A. Ingalls when he served as a Field Representative of the International Union of Electrical, Radio & Machine Workers, AFL-CIO. They include contracts, correspondence, legal records, financial records, newspaper clippings and notes from when Ingalls represented Connecticut local chapters to negotiate contracts, resolve strikes and lockouts, and develop collective bargaining agreements, pension plans and compensation and health benefits packages.

Connecticut companies (and their corresponding locals) include Acme Electric of Cuba, New York, American Optical of Hartford (local 408), Ametek in West Hartford (local 281), Atlantic Machine Tools in Newington, Bowser Technical Refrigeration, Bridgeport Metal Goods of Bridgeport (local 237), Brunswick Corp. of Torrington (local 247), Bussmann Division of McGraw-Edison of Bristol (local 260), Carlyle Johnson Machine Co. of Manchester (local 281), Connecticut Telephone & Electric Corporation of Meriden (local 285), Eagle Lock & Screw Company (local 256), V.C.A. Division of Ethyl Corp. in Bridgeport (local 238), Fenn Manufacturing Co. of Newington (local 266), Gray & Prior Machine Co. of Bloomfield (local 281), Hanson-Whitney Co. of Hartford (local 295), H.P. Townsend Mfg. Co. of West Hartford (local 281), Hi-G Co. Inc. of Windsor Locks (local 280), Ingraham Industries of Bristol (local 260), Keeney Manufacturing Co. of Newington (local 215), Kingfisher of Vernon, Merrow Machine Co. of Hartford (local 249), New England Carbide (local 257), Sculli Machine Co. of East Hartford (local 281), Sessions Clock Company in Forestville (local 261), Son-Chief Electronics in Winsted (local 212), Terry Corporation (local 289), Union Hardware Division of Brunswick Corporation of Torrington (local 247), Woodside Precision Corp. (local 256), and Yankee Metal Product Corp. of Norwalk (local 245).

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Archives & Special Collections has a substantial collection of materials pertaining to Connecticut labor. For detailed information on these collections please contact the curator or ask at the Reading Room desk.

acqinfo.head: Provenance and Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The Papers were donated to the University of Connecticut by James A. Ingalls in 1992.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use and Copyright Information
userestrict.p: Permission to publish from these Papers must be obtained in writing from both the University of Connecticut Libraries and the owner(s) of the copyright.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The collection is open and available for research.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Item description, #:#], James A. Ingalls Papers. Archives & Special Collections at the Thomas J. Dodd Research Center, University of Connecticut Libraries.

did.unittitle: Series I: Inventory

Papers of negotiations of the following Connecticut companies and their corresponding locals: Atlantic Machine Tools in Newington, Bowser Technical Refrigeration, Connecticut Telephone & Electric Corporation of Meriden (local 285), Eagle Lock & Screw Company (local 256), Sessions Clock Company in Forestville (local 261), Son-Chief Electronics in Winsted (local 212), Terry Corporation (local 289), Woodside Precision Corp. (local 256),
